answers.answer: Morning CherylSome patients with Hashimoto's Thyroiditis may have no symptoms. However, the common symptoms are fatigue, depression, and sensitivity to cold, weight gain, muscle weakness, coarsening of the skin, dry or brittle hair, constipation, muscle cramps, increased menstrual flow, and goiter (enlargement of the thyroid gland).Treatment as we all know is Thyroid supplement drugs sometimes for life. Wish her luck.Nikki
What kind of thyroiditis did she have?  There are several.
